meta.job_title: Home Study and Post Release Services Caseworker

duties_responsibilities.duty: Conduct in-person home visits to promote safety and stabilization of children released from federal care to their sponsor.
Assess the need for different levels of care and develop individualized strength-based service plans.
Coordinate referrals and address barriers in relevant service need areas (e.g. legal, education, medical, mental health).
Support unaccompanied children and sponsors with enrollment and access to community services.
Provide psychoeducation to children and sponsors on relevant topics and family reunification stressors.
Monitor progress, safety, and well-being of children, including indications of trafficking, abuse, and neglect.
Create and revise safety plans as needed and serve as a mandated reporter.
Network and develop partnerships to educate providers on children’s needs and reinforce partnerships in relevant areas.
Write case notes, enter data, and complete reports in a time-sensitive manner.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in social work, education, psychology, sociology, or other behavioral science (MSW Preferred)
Ability to read and write in Spanish and English
